Structs/FileHandleTextStream.html#/s:4sw.name: encoding
Structs/FileHandleTextStream.html#/s:4sw.abstract: the encoding used to write to the handle

Structs/FileHandleTextStream.html#/s:4sw.name: init(_:encoding:)
Structs/FileHandleTextStream.html#/s:4sw.abstract: Create a text stream that writes to the filehandle using the specified encoding

Structs/ExitCodeFailure.html#/s:4swsh15E.name: name
Structs/ExitCodeFailure.html#/s:4swsh15E.abstract: The name of the process that failed

Structs/ExitCodeFailure.html#/s:4swsh15E.name: exitCode
Structs/ExitCodeFailure.html#/s:4swsh15E.abstract: The exit code of the failed process

Structs/InvalidString.html.name: InvalidString
Structs/InvalidString.html.abstract: Thrown when a string cannot be created with the requested encoding

Structs/StringEncodingError.html.name: StringEncodingError
Structs/StringEncodingError.html.abstract: Thrown when a string cannot be encoded with the requested incoding

Structs/ExitCodeFailure.html.name: ExitCodeFailure
Structs/ExitCodeFailure.html.abstract: An error thrown by some forms of running caused when the exit code of the child process is non-zero

Structs/FileHandleTextStream.html.name: FileHandleTextStream
Structs/FileHandleTextStream.html.abstract: A wrapper to convert a FileHandle into a TextOutputStream

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: FDMap
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: A list of file descriptor remappings. Order matters, same as in bash

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: coreAsync(fdMap:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: The minimum requirement of a Command is that it can launch itself asynchronously

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: asyncStream(joinErr:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Run the command asynchronously, and return a stream open on process’s stdout

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: run()
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Run the command synchronously, and return nothing if successful

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: runBool()
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Run the command synchronously, and return true if the command exited zero

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: runFile()
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Run the command synchronously, directing the output to a temporary file

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: runData(joinErr:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Run the command synchronously, and collect stdout.

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: runString(encoding:joinErr:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Run the command synchronously, and collect stdout into a string.

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: runLines(encoding:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Run the command synchronously, and collect output line-by-line as a list of strings

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: runList(delimiter:encoding:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Run the command synchronously, and collect output as a list of strings

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: runJson(options:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Run the command synchronously, and collect output as a parsed JSON object

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: runJson(_:decoder:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Run the command synchronously, and collect output as a parsed JSON object

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: output(creatingFile:fd:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Bind output to a file. Similar to “>” in bash, but will not overwrite the file

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: output(overwritingFile:fd:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Bind output to a file, creating if needed. Similar to “>” in bash

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: append(toFile:fd:createFile:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Bind output to end of a file. Similar to “>>” in bash

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: input(_:encoding:fd:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Bind stdin to contents of string

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: input(_:fd:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Bind stdin to contents of data

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: input(withJSONObject:fd:options:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Bind stdin to the the JSON representation of a JSON-like value

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: inputJSON(from:fd:encoder:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Bind stdin to the the JSON representation of a JSON-encodable value

Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.name: input(fromFile:fd:)
Protocols/Command.html#/s:4swsh7CommandP.abstract: Bind stdin to a file, similar to < file in bash
Convenience function to create a 2-command pipeline

Protocols/CommandResult.html#/s:4swsh13C.name: isRunning
Protocols/CommandResult.html#/s:4swsh13C.abstract: Returns true if the command is still running

Protocols/CommandResult.html#/s:4swsh13C.name: exitCode()
Protocols/CommandResult.html#/s:4swsh13C.abstract: Block until command is finished, and return exit code

Protocols/CommandResult.html#/s:4swsh13C.name: succeed()
Protocols/CommandResult.html#/s:4swsh13C.abstract: Block and throw an error if exitCode is non-zero

Protocols/CommandResult.html#/s:4swsh13C.name: finish()
Protocols/CommandResult.html#/s:4swsh13C.abstract: Wait for the command to finish, ignoring any exit code

Protocols/CommandResult.html#/s:4swsh13C.name: defaultSucceed(name:)
Protocols/CommandResult.html#/s:4swsh13C.abstract: A default implementation that can be used for succeed

Protocols/Command.html.name: Command
Protocols/Command.html.abstract: Represents a description of a command that can be executed any number of times, but usually just once.

Functions.html#/s:4swsh3cmd_9argumentsAA.name: cmd(_:arguments:)
Functions.html#/s:4swsh3cmd_9argumentsAA.abstract: Convenience function for creating an extternal command. Does not run the command.

Functions.html#/s:4swsh3cmdyAA15External.name: cmd(_:_:)
Functions.html#/s:4swsh3cmdyAA15External.abstract: Convenience function for creating an extternal command. Does not run the command.

Classes/Pipeline.html#/s:4swsh8PipelineC.name: init(_:_:)
Classes/Pipeline.html#/s:4swsh8PipelineC.abstract: Create a pipeline from 1 or more sub-commands

Classes/ExternalCommand.html#/s:4swsh15E.name: environment
Classes/ExternalCommand.html#/s:4swsh15E.abstract: The environment variables the command will be launched with

Classes/ExternalCommand.html#/s:4swsh15E.name: verbose
Classes/ExternalCommand.html#/s:4swsh15E.abstract: like “set -x”, this will cause all external commands to print themselves when they run

Classes/ExternalCommand.html#/s:4swsh15E.name: init(_:arguments:addEnv:)
Classes/ExternalCommand.html#/s:4swsh15E.abstract: Creates the command, but does not run it

Classes/SyscallError.html#/s:4swsh12Sysc.name: name
Classes/SyscallError.html#/s:4swsh12Sysc.abstract: A short description of the operation that generated the error

Classes/SyscallError.html#/s:4swsh12Sysc.name: errno
Classes/SyscallError.html#/s:4swsh12Sysc.abstract: The errno set by the failing instruction

Classes/ExternalCommand.html.name: ExternalCommand
Classes/ExternalCommand.html.abstract: Represents an external program invocation. It is the lowest-level command, that will spawn a subprocess when run.

Classes/Pipeline.html.name: Pipeline
Classes/Pipeline.html.abstract: A Pipeline is 0 or more pipes connecting 1 or more subcommands together like the unix a | b | ...
